data.title: Robert (Bob) Reimer
data.meta_description: Robert (Bob) Raymond Reimer (83) passed away July 30, 2024, peacefully at home in Bena, MN.
data.text:
Robert (Bob) Raymond Reimer (83) passed away July 30, 2024, peacefully at home in Bena, MN.

Memorial services for Bob will be 11:00 a.m. on Friday, August 9, 2024, at St. Charles

Catholic Church in Cass Lake, MN with visitation one hour prior to service. Luncheon will follow service. Burial with Military Honors at Pine Grove Cemetery in Cass Lake following the luncheon.

Bob was born March 16, 1941, to Charles and Venona (Fisher) Reimer in Minneapolis, MN. The

family moved to Cass Lake when Bob was young. He graduated from Cass Lake High School in 1959 and in January 1960 was accepted for enlistment to the U.S. Marine Corps. Bob was honorably discharged as a Corporal in January 1964.

Bob and Nadine (Robinson) were married in July of 1963. They had four children, Paige, James, Sonja, and Tracy. They lived most of their lives in the Cass Lake area. Bob was employed at St. Regis Lumber where he built bridges and culverts. After divorcing, Bob worked as a self-employed carpenter and mentored many young men. Bob had a strong work ethic and continued fixing and building until the end of his life. He also enjoyed time with his family, hunting, football, and panning for gold. In his quiet manner he was led to help others, guided by his faith in God.

He is survived by Nadine, mother of his children; daughter, Paige (Craig) Brown; son, James (Julie) Reimer; daughter, Sonja (Carey) Brown; daughter, Tracy (Don) Reimer. Grandchildren: Matthew (Jackie) Brown; Nathan (Tessa) Brown; Noah Reimer; Evan Reimer; Casey (Emily) Reimer; Nicole (Sophie) Tucker; Josh (Anna) Gregerson; Ashley (Aria) Gregerson. Great grandchildren: Mila and Jema (Matt) Brown; Lily and Archer (Nate) Brown; Bryson and Milo (Josh) Gregerson. Sisters, Barbara (Charlie) Goss and Becky Reimer; brother, Paul (Linda) Reimer; brother-in-law, Mike (Bonnie) Mabes; several cousins, nieces and nephews.

He was preceded in death by his parents, two brothers, Chuck Jr. and James; son-in-law, Craig (Paige) Brown, and great grandson, Liam (Matt) Brown.

Condolences may be left at ceasefuneralhome.com.
